p: Along with the spread of COVID-19, the Indian Government enforced a 21-day national lockdown and then maintained a full lockdown at hotspots to limit the spread of the virus transmission. These precautions taken by the Indian Government could help limit the health crisis, but the complete lockdown has plunged the Indian economy into recession. India’s economic shock could be even more serious for two reasons. First, the economy slowed before COVID-19, exacerbating existing unemployment, low incomes, rural hardship, malnutrition, and general inequality. Second, India’s large informal sector is particularly vulnerable.
